title: `cc_binary` does not allow use of `select()` in `deps` when also using `dynamic_deps`

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

body:
### Description of the bug:


I am using bazel 7.1.1 and if I create a cc_binary with

1. A dynamic_deps dependency
2. A select() in the deps attribute

I would get an error message

```
File "/virtual_builtins_bzl/common/cc/cc_shared_library.bzl", line 854, column 28, in cc_shared_library_initializer
Error in extend: type 'select' is not iterable
```

### Which category does this issue belong to?

C++ Rules, Core

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


Create a `BUILD` file with this content

```
load("@rules_cc//cc:defs.bzl", "cc_binary", "cc_library")

cc_binary(
    name = "test",
    srcs = ["main.cpp"],
    dynamic_deps = [":anything"],
    deps = select({
        "//:my_config": [":any_cc_lib"],
        "//conditions:default": [],
    }),
)
```

The `config_setting`, `cc_library`, `cc_shared_library` do not need to exist. It fails immediately I believe in the analysis phase

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


Ubuntu 20.04

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 7.1.1 and release 7.0.2
